text: {"answer":"Y","reasoning":"ii is incorrect because Swiss res judicata (materielle Rechtskraft) is generally limited to the operative part (Dispositiv) of the judgment, not all factual findings and legal assessments. iii is incorrect because an arbitral tribunal’s jurisdiction decision is subject to limited state-court review (e.g., annulment/setting-aside grounds). iv is incorrect because the described “observe and then reintroduce findings into the legal system” corresponds to legal doctrine/dogmatics, whereas legal sociology typically studies law empirically from an external perspective rather than feeding results back as doctrinal prescriptions. i is generally considered correct (Swiss neutrality is tied to recognition in 1815, but Westphalia is often cited as an early milestone), and v is correct as a basic principle of limited liability in Swiss corporate forms like the GmbH."}
